alert.note: Alert for Northern New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 5:19PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central New Haven County through 600 PM EDT... At 519 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Seymour, or near Naugatuck, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Haven, Shelton, Naugatuck, Southbury, Hamden, North Haven, Seymour, Derby, Prospect, Woodbridge, Beacon Falls, Bethany, Ansonia and Oxford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
